pageContext.claim: “When the Tennessee Valley Authority replaced part of its American workforce with foreign workers, I told the board chairman, 'Chairman, you're fired. Out, you're fired, chairman.' You know what he was making? This had nothing to do with me. He was making $8,000,000 a year. He's the highest paid government official, semi-government, it's like a private, semi-private deal. $8,000,000 a year and I said, 'You're fired.'”
pageContext.analysis: The Tennessee Valley Authority CEO made a base salary of $445,846. He earned a signing bonus and additional compensation. His future pension package pushed his earnings to $8 million — but that is not paid annually as Trump says.
